algorithm_technique: Hashmap for frequency counting and optimized product search.
problem_summary_simple: Find triplets where a number squared equals the product of two other numbers from the other array.
problem_summary_technical: For each number in one array, find pairs in the other array whose product equals its square. Use hashmap for O(1) lookups.
key_insights: The core idea is to efficiently find pairs that multiply to a target value.
Using a hashmap (or frequency map) to store counts of numbers in one array allows for quick lookups.
The problem can be broken down into two symmetric cases: nums1[i]^2 = nums2[j]*nums2[k] and nums2[i]^2 = nums1[j]*nums1[k].
